ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned Chinese (the ability to have basic conversations in Chinese) and gained some insights into Chinese culture.
Learning the basics of Chinese grammar and vocabulary, having conversations in Mandarin, and learning about Chinese culture.

Throughout the course, I developed a solid foundation in the Chinese language, gaining essential knowledge of grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation. The skills I acquired have enabled me to engage in basic conversations, read simple texts, and write in Chinese. Sometimes a bit too fast-paced, but that is understandable (don't let it discourage you from taking this course)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
It's actually great that we meet daily and have daily homework (although sometimes it can be a lot). The structure of the course and the exams also ensures that we improve in all areas - speaking, writing, reading, and listening.
I also like the smaller class sizes.
It is very fast-paced, I would appreciate if it was slower with less homework

Overall, the course was very well structured and provided students with a great learning environment. Homework assignments and overall speed of the advancement of courses (grammar and lectures) might have been a little too much/too fast in the sense that students had little time to revise past lectures.
really fast paced (you need lots of motivation), lots of fun, learnt tons of new things

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you want to learn Chinese, the program at Yale is perfect.
Sure, if they had an interest in Chinese and were serious about their learning
I would, if they are willing to dedicate a significant amount of their time to studying a new language.
yes, but only if you are sure that you want to learn Chinese; this class will probably take most of your time, so try to balance your schedule and take at least one gut class alongside CHNS.
